snippet.textDisplay:
I had seen this game a few months before it came out. Now I am a pretty big fan of RPGs. Just from the screenshots and small preview videos I knew it was going to be an amazing game. 

After playing it for 50 hours so far I am confident any RPG fan would love this game. The voice acting is on par with anime/film performances, gameplay is exciting, character design is fun but not childish (they feel like people you’d meet), and the storyline is interesting. Great world to explore. Im going to recreate it in DnD because it’s such an amazing setting.
snippet.textOriginal:
I had seen this game a few months before it came out. Now I am a pretty big fan of RPGs. Just from the screenshots and small preview videos I knew it was going to be an amazing game. 

After playing it for 50 hours so far I am confident any RPG fan would love this game. The voice acting is on par with anime/film performances, gameplay is exciting, character design is fun but not childish (they feel like people you’d meet), and the storyline is interesting. Great world to explore. Im going to recreate it in DnD because it’s such an amazing setting.

snippet.textDisplay:
Aesthetically a mix between persona, final fantasy and french art, stunning 10/10

Story and characters are touching, not overly pretencious (as I was scared of because french art tend to do that) 10/10

Musically a mix between melancholic french music and rythmic persona music. A lot of very similar tunes but a some are incredible 9/10

Level design, and by that I mean the levels layout..;eeeh 6/10, the worldmap is well made but the levels themselves are kind of just corridors with missable subpaths that provide cool stuff forcing you to zigzag all the time in fear of misisng a little interactable element

Gameplay wise, a mixed bag, as a turn based fan I wish they dived deeper on the turn based strategy (making OP builds is very easy) and less on the parry system (I'm  bit tired of seeing parries in every single games nowadays) 
Also honestly, the gameplay is more like 80% timing and 20% strategy, because making strong build is so easy, at the end of the day the only thing that will challenge you is managing to land enough parries to survive long enough to kill the bosses. sooo 7/10

overall a solid 8.5/10 
Great game, potential GOTY but not better than Metaphor or Baldur's Gate 3 in my opinion

snippet.textDisplay: As a person who normally doesn't like QTE systems, I really enjoyed the attack system in this game. The defense system was too much of a learning curve for me to get in to. After my 3rd failed tutorial battle on medium difficulty due to getting 3 shot after failing to dodge or parry, I just turned the game off and never turned it back on. The game could be GOTY material, and I'll never know because the combat system isn't accessible enough for me. They even give you an option to essentially turn off the attack QTEs, but no way to adjust defense. That decision alone just boggles my mind...
snippet.textOriginal: As a person who normally doesn't like QTE systems, I really enjoyed the attack system in this game. The defense system was too much of a learning curve for me to get in to. After my 3rd failed tutorial battle on medium difficulty due to getting 3 shot after failing to dodge or parry, I just turned the game off and never turned it back on. The game could be GOTY material, and I'll never know because the combat system isn't accessible enough for me. They even give you an option to essentially turn off the attack QTEs, but no way to adjust defense. That decision alone just boggles my mind...

the only nit pick is that "expert" mode hasn't felt much different from normal imo..the timings don't seem much different n if they are i haven't noticed.. also the way the picto/lumina system there are some BROKEN ass builds in the latter 3rd of this game.. like I said b4 I'm not a good turn-based player in general and soo I'm not that great at "building" teams to be "godlike".. even if i did it would trivialize the thr 3rd act in general soo I wouldn't do it even if I had the option to do so.

snippet.textDisplay:
I love it.  I finally found the appeal on my second play session.  I love the dialogue, the acting, as for the story i think i need to give it more time.  But the best thing about it has to be the battling.  I find myself wanting to find new enemies and besting them

But what i dont care for is the music is louder than the dialogue on default.  The ground and sky are far too busy.  There's far too much use of glowing assets.  I would've liked more diversity for the main characters, similar to final fantasy games.

snippet.textDisplay: I like to use the term “interactive turn based.” It’s not exactly a new concept. The older Paper Mario games worked similarly. You had to react on the enemies turn to avoid damage or do parries. Plus the interactions during your own turn with your attacks and with the crowd. Expedition 33 is just a bit more sweaty. I don’t like how hard games get compared to the Souls franchise. It literally plays nothing like a souls game. We just use the term “souls like” to describe a game’s difficulty level.
snippet.textOriginal: I like to use the term “interactive turn based.” It’s not exactly a new concept. The older Paper Mario games worked similarly. You had to react on the enemies turn to avoid damage or do parries. Plus the interactions during your own turn with your attacks and with the crowd. Expedition 33 is just a bit more sweaty. I don’t like how hard games get compared to the Souls franchise. It literally plays nothing like a souls game. We just use the term “souls like” to describe a game’s difficulty level.

snippet.textDisplay: I definitely wouldn’t call it Soulslike. It is a turn-based RPG through and through, with unique mechanics for each party member. It doesn’t really punish you for dying, and the story is far more prevalent and interesting than any Dark Souls game (which have great lore, but mediocre stories). Weirdly enough, I would prolly compare the parrying combat to a rhythm game more than I would Dark Souls (except for Sekiro, which is basically a rhythm game)
snippet.textOriginal: I definitely wouldn’t call it Soulslike. It is a turn-based RPG through and through, with unique mechanics for each party member. It doesn’t really punish you for dying, and the story is far more prevalent and interesting than any Dark Souls game (which have great lore, but mediocre stories). Weirdly enough, I would prolly compare the parrying combat to a rhythm game more than I would Dark Souls (except for Sekiro, which is basically a rhythm game)

snippet.textDisplay:
If you're anything like me, you will find yourself getting extremely frustrated early on. Keep pushing and realize that certain enemies are much easier to parry or dodge than others.
Don't go  into this game assuming you will be parrying everything. Save that for later when you are much more used to the combat and enemy types.

I will also note that the camera in this game will mess with you hard. Much like any souls-like. I find it easier to parry the same enemy's attacks based on what position(left, right, or middle) they attack even when they're using the same move.
snippet.textOriginal:

I will also note that the camera in this game will mess with you hard. Much like any souls-like. I find it easier to parry the same enemy's attacks based on what position(left, right, or middle) they attack even when they're using the same move.

snippet.textDisplay:
I have played video games since I was a child. My very first console was the Game Cube and I have had nearly every major console released since then. 

The video game hobby is incredibly important to me because it has brought me so much joy and depth to my life. Some of my favorite stories and characters come from games. 

I want game studios who make fun and interesting games, good games, to have all the success they could possibly want. 

With all that said: developers. I am BEGGING you: please get off the soulslike bandwagon. 99% of action games released after Dark Souls 3 have been soulslike games. Including some games I was incredibly excited to play. 

I’m glad games like Dark Souls, Elden Ring, Lies of P and Black Myth Wukong are enjoyed by so many people but I don’t. I have never seen grueling difficult and ceaseless challenge as engaging or satisfying. 

Please, PLEASE, make other kinds of action games. God of War style hack and slash, musou, DMC style spectacle fighter… Just please stop drowning me in games that only masochists and sweat lords crave. I don’t want to be weak and struggle, I play games to feel powerful and competent!

PLEASE!
snippet.textOriginal:

The video game hobby is incredibly important to me because it has brought me so much joy and depth to my life. Some of my favorite stories and characters come from games. 

I want game studios who make fun and interesting games, good games, to have all the success they could possibly want. 

With all that said: developers. I am BEGGING you: please get off the soulslike bandwagon. 99% of action games released after Dark Souls 3 have been soulslike games. Including some games I was incredibly excited to play. 

I’m glad games like Dark Souls, Elden Ring, Lies of P and Black Myth Wukong are enjoyed by so many people but I don’t. I have never seen grueling difficult and ceaseless challenge as engaging or satisfying. 

Please, PLEASE, make other kinds of action games. God of War style hack and slash, musou, DMC style spectacle fighter… Just please stop drowning me in games that only masochists and sweat lords crave. I don’t want to be weak and struggle, I play games to feel powerful and competent!

PLEASE!

snippet.textDisplay:
Let me say, hands down this game is everything i could ever want. Its got hiccups and parts i didnt/dont like but its still a 9.9/10 for me.

For those worried about parries and dodging, yes there is an easy mode that makes this a bit more lax.

You dont have to parry everything (but why wouldnt you 😂) dodging is reasonably generous

You think the game is gonna get stale with combat but imo, once you find a team to bounce different buffs/debuffs it makes it more fun.

One of my annoyances but i havent checked (only one boss so far has been like...jesus man can i see where my ppl are) sometimes when the enemy attacks the camera zooms out to show you the entire world map and some 1s and 0s. 

There is an accessibility option to keep the camera from doing that but before i knew this i had to make a call to use the Hubble Telescope to see my people.

The story is awesome but sometimes it falls a bit flat in parts but overall its amazing and when you think its over...surprise man. Act 3 is amazing.

I will say sometimes, very rarely it feels like you parried correctly and it ends up usually getting you killed if its like multiple hits.

snippet.textDisplay: The amount of hate this game is getting is mind boggling and it’s like, bro have you even played it? Even if the combat which is the main point of contention isn’t what YOU want it to be exactly the story is beautifully written, the dialogue as well, the voice acting is too notch, graphically stunning, extremely polished BEFORE RELEASE!!! The OST is amazingly composed, the comedy is superbly woven into the dialogue unlike marvels comedy it fits and doesn’t feel forced or overshadow other themes, and it’s actually funny, it’s got countless little Easter eggs and homages to other games and even memes, the characters connect with you so well, especially maelle and the best character Esqiue (I think that’s how you spell it).  The world doesn’t feel empty yet giant like rebirth did, the rewards for detours are very much worth it, talking to each character you encounter (or trash can) is rewarded with even a little bit of world building or lore or full on side quests, your hand isn’t held past the prologue, the overworks map is done fantastically compared to what nearly any other game with overworld exploration has done.  If you took the combat system and replaced it with a standard generic turn based one, or a weird hybrid like ff7r did this would still be a fucking BANGER and 100% worth the 50$!!!! Base price!!!! Not even full price like idk for me this was a no brainer I have been wanting something like this for a very long time, it bring me back to when I first got into rpg’s with FFX and I gotta say…Square Enix…if you want to have your beloved franchise mount a comeback for the ages…copy your own homework from 20 years ago, and maybe take a couple pages from this game.
snippet.textOriginal: The amount of hate this game is getting is mind boggling and it’s like, bro have you even played it? Even if the combat which is the main point of contention isn’t what YOU want it to be exactly the story is beautifully written, the dialogue as well, the voice acting is too notch, graphically stunning, extremely polished BEFORE RELEASE!!! The OST is amazingly composed, the comedy is superbly woven into the dialogue unlike marvels comedy it fits and doesn’t feel forced or overshadow other themes, and it’s actually funny, it’s got countless little Easter eggs and homages to other games and even memes, the characters connect with you so well, especially maelle and the best character Esqiue (I think that’s how you spell it).  The world doesn’t feel empty yet giant like rebirth did, the rewards for detours are very much worth it, talking to each character you encounter (or trash can) is rewarded with even a little bit of world building or lore or full on side quests, your hand isn’t held past the prologue, the overworks map is done fantastically compared to what nearly any other game with overworld exploration has done.  If you took the combat system and replaced it with a standard generic turn based one, or a weird hybrid like ff7r did this would still be a fucking BANGER and 100% worth the 50$!!!! Base price!!!! Not even full price like idk for me this was a no brainer I have been wanting something like this for a very long time, it bring me back to when I first got into rpg’s with FFX and I gotta say…Square Enix…if you want to have your beloved franchise mount a comeback for the ages…copy your own homework from 20 years ago, and maybe take a couple pages from this game.

I wasn't gonna play this game because of the turn based combat but now I refuse to play it because it has "souls-like" turn based combat. That sounds fucking horrendous to me. You described the combat system in everyway except the way I want a game to be described. Fun. and a souls-like isn't fun if you actually want to playTHROUGH a game. I don't play games that the entire gimmick is You'll die spending a hour on a single boss then get gaslit into thinking you accomplished something. 

I play guitar. If I spend a hour or more recording a part and then nail it. I'm not excited, happy or feeling accomplished I'm pissed because before I hit record I was nailing the entire song. Now I can't nail this maybe 30 second part. It shouldn't take me that long to do something that I can do so I'm just failing until I do it right and I might just be normal but doing 1 thing right after a hour, if not hours of failing doesn't make that hour okay. I wasted a hour of my life and I spent it annoyed and angry that I DID NOTHING. And that's anything "souls" to me. I spend X amount of failing at something that I can do easily and what did I get out of it? Oh slight progress and a hour wasted to a emotion I hate... I play games because they are fun and I value every second I have on this shithole planet and spending it on a game where the gimmick is failure until you succeed once isn't fun. Love You Thor but you just made sure I'd never touch this game.

snippet.textDisplay: If you dont like turn based games like I dont like them, Ill tell you this. It does feel turn based but the added interactability like dodging, parrying, and crit boosting makes it feel more like a real time combat game. Its a solid middle ground but it does absolutely still feel like its turn based, because, by definition, it is.

snippet.textDisplay: If this game isn't at least nominated for GOTY we riot. It's seriously so good. I've had dreams of a game like Expedition 33 back when I was a kid playing games like Paper Mario or Dragon Quest or of course Final Fantasy 7, 9 and 10. Mechanically speaking, it's all I ever wanted out of a turn based game. This isn't even touching on the story and music which are also fantastic.
